page.title: 17 THE RAILWAYS
page.content: The first railway was the Norwich and Spalding which came from Spalding to Sutton Bridge in 1862. It was a single track railway worked by G.N.R. Also a single track railway was the Sutton Bridge to King's Lynn which was controlled from Lynn in 1864.The Peterborough, Wisbech and Sutton Railway was opened in 1866 with a single track between these three places. At this time my great, great grandfather Edwin Pott came to be Station Master at the second station house which was built in 1864. Edwin was Station Master for 32 years and died in 1896, over 70. My Grandmother had a brother called Edwin who later became a railway clerk.The station was enlarged in 1897 and various companies amalgamated, eventually becoming The Midland and Great Northern Joint Railway.
